ranked_diseases.explanation: Patient presents with classic NF1 features including multiple cafe-au-lait spots, freckling, skeletal abnormalities (pectus excavatum, kyphosis, scoliosis), and astrocytoma. All three reference cases with similar presentations were diagnosed with NF1.

Also known as NF1-like syndrome, presents with cafe-au-lait spots and freckling similar to NF1, but typically lacks neurofibromas and CNS tumors. The presence of astrocytoma makes this less likely than NF1.
Can present with cafe-au-lait spots and brain tumors including astrocytomas, particularly in younger patients. However, the skeletal abnormalities and freckling pattern are more consistent with NF1.
Features cafe-au-lait spots and skeletal abnormalities, but the spots typically have irregular borders and respect the midline. The presence of freckling and astrocytoma are not typical features.
While NF2 can present with CNS tumors, it typically lacks the extensive cutaneous manifestations seen in this patient. Cafe-au-lait spots are less common and freckling is not a typical feature.
